page.title: 19GUERNSEY TOMATO MARKETING
page.content: Once tomatoes are picked they are sent to the{Guernsey Tomato Marketing Board to be packed and{exported.}First they are put into a cool room to cool off. Then they go onto a set of rollers to a trough of water to be cleaned.Then they are dried with cool air and travel past an{electronic eye}which sorts them into different grades according to size and colour. Very red or green fruit gets rejected. Then they are weighed into 6kilos and packed into a tray,and covered with a special coloured plastic lid denoting each grade. Finally they are put onto a turntable and stacked up on palettes of 130 trays. These stacks are then taken by lorry to the docks and sent to the various markets in the U.K. Aubergines peppers,beans radish & celery are also packed at the GTMB.
